creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture
description: procession of five dancing skeletons; second and third skeletons are each holding a red stamp in their hand; last two skeletons are rendered in lighter grey ink; inscription with stamps at URC
inscription: URQ: 無論君体評妍魄。唯觀髑髏之活動 (It doesn\'t matter that you are blessed with a beautiful form; just look at the actions of your skull) (See Berry and Morioka, Literati Modern, p234, panel 6)
markings: URC, long, rectangular relief stamp; URQ, top stamp large, square intaglio stamp：:土井恪印 URQ, lower stamp: large, square relief stamp：恭氏; L of center: horizontal rectangular intaglio stamp：此画此時一談一笑; LRQ, horizontal rectangular intaglio stamp：不如学
title: Skeletons Holding Seals
